current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To authorize the award of the Medal of Honor to Henry Johnson.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text: Authorization for award of the Medal of Honor to Henry Johnson for acts of valor during World War I

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or
			 any other time limitation with respect to the awarding of certain medals

may award the
			 Medal of Honor under

to Henry Johnson for the
			 acts of valor during World War I described in subsection (b).

text.#text: Notwithstanding the time limitations specified in

The acts of valor referred to in subsection (a) are the actions of Henry Johnson while serving as a
			 member of Company C, 369th Infantry Regiment, 93rd Division, American
			 Expeditionary Forces, during combat operations against the enemy on the
			 front lines of the Western Front in France on May 15, 1918, during World
			 War I for which he was previously awarded the Distinguished Service Cross.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2793 IS: To authorize the award of the Medal of Honor to Henry Johnson.
